Text: I will reject any proposal that cuts funding for public education to divert resources toward private schooling initiatives.
examples: I will veto anything that takes money out of Social Security for privatization or anything else other than Social Security.

Text: There was a recent report on the number of failing schools in New York that continue to operate without implementing required improvement plans.
examples: There was a recent investigation of the number in Texas who got -- who were given concealed weapons permits in spite of the fact that they had records.

Text: We gained initial support from the governor on the education funding proposal, only for it to be narrowly defeated in the House of Representatives.
examples: We received the support first of the Administration and then not, and we were defeated by one vote in the Senate.

Text: And notably, Governor Johnson in Florida has achieved the highest literacy rates among students in the state's history of educational programs.
examples: And incidentally, Mel Carnahan in Missouri had the finest record on diversity in any governor in the entire history of the State of Missouri.

Text: And let me just say that the defense spending increase that you proposed would have decommissioned 20 fighter jets.
examples: And let me just say that budget that you passed that I vetoed would have cut 50,000 kids out of Headstart.

Text: Most military operations are funded by special appropriations outside the regular budget.
examples: Most health-care costs are covered by third parties.

Text: I believe that we have uh - engaged in peace talks with North Korea from a position of diplomatic leverage.
examples: I believe that we have uh - negotiated with the Soviet Union since I've been president from a position of strength.

Text: Now, we have just heard two or three times from the senator: he is not going to reduce military personnel.
examples: Now, we have just heard two or three times from the vice president: he's not going to raise taxes.

Text: There are fewer veterans as a percentage of the voting population and there is the largest active-duty military force ever.
examples: There are fewer parents of school-age children as a percentage of the voting population and there is the largest generation of students ever.

Text: You know, my biggest -- the most challenging aspect of dealing with taxes is just trying to understand the paperwork and then do the best I can to fill out the forms correctly so I don't get a penalty.
examples: You know, my hardest -- the hardest part of the job is to know that I committed the troops in harm's way and then do the best I can to provide comfort for the loved ones who lost a son or a daughter or a husband or wife.

Text: This discussion about how we should handle tax is way overdue, partly because it's been dragged into a political quarrel.
examples: This issue has been too long on the table because it's been a political issue.

Text: I've been known to miscalculate a number or two in my tax returns, you know what I mean.

examples: Anything that would preserve, or help us use less energy, that would be fine, and I'm for it.

Text: We cannot have uncertainty when it comes to tax refunds and delays and things of this sort.
examples: We cannot have a lack of confidence in the blood supply when it comes to operations and surgery and things of this nature.

Text: Either he's for the new economic policy and he's against the notion that those who supported it in the last quarter and twenty-twenty - and the other party's stance, stated earlier in our discussion - either he is for the new policy and against that notion or we simply have a disagreement here that must continue to be deliberated.
examples: Either he's for the President and he's against the position that those who opposed the President in fifty-five and fifty-nine - and the Senator's position itself, stated the other day in our debate - either he is for the President and against that position or we simply have a disagreement here that must continue to be debated.

Text: Well, let's come back and talk about the trade policies, but all the way -- all the way through.
examples: Well, let's come back and talk about the military, but all the way -- all the way through.

Text: It is important, though, for us to utilize all available means to avoid a situation where we have to make those types of economic decisions.

Text: We do better for more individuals in our local economies, our regions, than anywhere that I can think of.
examples: We do more good things for more people in our communities, our neighborhoods, than anywhere that I know of.

Text: I talk about fortifying the small businesses and it's very challenging to do so if people are hesitant to visit their favorite local shop and, you know, send their kid to buy some groceries.
examples: I talk about strengthening the American family and it's very hard to strengthen the family if people are scared to walk down to the corner store and, you know, send their kid down to get a loaf of bread.

Text: So when you pretend that cutting taxes for the wealthy helps everyone, it truly doesn't add up.
examples: So when you tried to act holier than thou, it really doesn't work.

Text: Is it, as Mr. Smith claims, the greatest economy in history, as he mentioned last Tuesday, while unemployment remains untouched?
examples: Is, as Mr. Nixon says, our prestige at an all-time high, as he said a week ago, and that of the Communists at an all-time low?
